channel.title: Qt on Petfactory

item.title: PySide2
item.description: This assumes you are using Python 3. Install with pip (Windows) Setup a virtual environment Lets say we want to install PySide in a virtual env. First we need to create the virtual enveronment. What I usually do is to create a directory for my project, cd into it and then run: python3 -m venv venv What this will do is to create a virtual environment (inside a new folder called venv) that will be placed inside the current directory.
